natural solution: From the angle subtraction formula, \[\cos (45^\circ - n^\circ) = \cos 45^\circ \cos n^\circ + \sin 45^\circ \sin n^\circ = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \cos n^\circ + \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \sin n^\circ,\]so $\cos n^\circ + \sin n^\circ = \sqrt{2} \cos (45^\circ - n^\circ).$  Summing over $1 \le n \le 44,$ we get
\[A + B = \sqrt{2} \sum_{n = 1}^{44} \cos (45^\circ - n^\circ) = A \sqrt{2}.\]Then $B = A \sqrt{2} - A = A (\sqrt{2} - 1),$ so \[\frac{A}{B} = \frac{A}{A (\sqrt{2} - 1)} = \boxed{1 + \sqrt{2}}.\]
